intro: Lipochaeta costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts. Lipochaeta costaricensis is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas within forests or along stream banks.
